intro: Batemannia colleyi subsp. peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian batemannia, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Andean regions of Peru. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. It features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in umbels. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native habitat.
